key_commands.description: Submit the final conclusion that no faulty components were detected.
Check reservation service logs for DB/cache setup and Consul registration.
Check user service logs to verify DB init and Consul registration.
Check rate service logs for DB/cache setup and Consul registration.
Check profile service logs for DB and cache initialization and Consul registration.
Examine Consul agent logs to verify leader election, health endpoints, and service registration events.
Inspect recommendation service logs for DB initialization and Consul registration status.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl logs -n test-hotel-reservation deploy/frontend --tail=200 | tail -n +1 && kubectl logs -n test-hotel-reservation deploy/search --tail=200 | tail -n +1 && kubectl logs -n test-hotel-reservation deploy/consul --tail=50 | tail -n +1 && kubectl get pods -n test-hotel-reservation -o wide")
key_commands.description: Aggregate logs from related services and display pod details to cross-check overall system health and timing around the geo restart.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl logs -n test-hotel-reservation deploy/frontend --tail=200 | tail -n +1 && kubectl logs -n test-hotel-reservation deploy/search --tail=200 | tail -n +1 && kubectl logs -n test-hotel-reservation deploy/consul --tail=50 | tail -n +1 && kubectl get pods -n test-hotel-reservation -o wide")

key_commands.description: Check frontend logs for client-visible errors (e.g., Consul connection refused) indicating system health issues.
Verify service endpoints to ensure backing pods are registered and discoverable.
Describe the geo pod to confirm container termination details (Last State Exit Code 137) indicating a container kill.
Inspect search service logs to confirm healthy initialization and Consul registration.
Retrieve recent application logs for the geo deployment to check runtime behavior around the restart.
List services to confirm service exposure and selectors for context.
List all pods in the namespace to identify abnormal statuses or restarts (geo shows a recent restart).
